title.narrative: Power of Voices FAIR for ALL TWN-A

description.narrative: Power of Voices FAIR for ALL developing capacity of civil society; advocacy and lobby to influence for fair agricultural and extractive value chains worldwide. TWN-Africa brings a successful combination of influencing and capacity strengthening work on extractives, with a focus on strengthening alliances in Africa. TWN-Africa is recognized by civil society, policymakers, ECOWAS and Pan-African leaders for its work on extractives, trade investment and finance, which forms a good base FAIR for ALL can build on. TWN-Africa’smineral governance work has contributed to sustainable policy shifts, such as the development of the African Minerals governance Framework (AMGF122) in 2017.

participating-org.narrative: TWN-Africa focuses on strategic development issues facing Africa in the age of globalization, especially from the perspectives of the vulnerable and marginalized. It also facilitates the organization and expression of African civil society at the supranational (regional, continental and global) levels on these issues. TWN-Africa#s programme of work for equitable policies and improvements in economic governance has been focused around the issues of: 1) Trade and Investment (especially the international trade and investment regime) and Finance 2) Regional Economic Integration 3) Gender and Economic policy 4) Mining and Development

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

Civil society enabled co-creation, implementation and scaling of alternative value-chains, in particular those that empower women producers and return FAIR share of value to rural communities, alongside more inclusive practices in existing value-chains.
Alternative business models / more inclusive practices in existing value chains

Civil society has contributed to a more responsible private and financial sector where trade and value-chains respect human, labour and environmental rights and increase (women’s) access to (productive) resources.
policy changes in private and/or financial sector actors' corporate accountability in trade and value chains
practice changes in private and/or financial sector actors' corporate accountability in trade and value chains

Civil society has contributed to trade, tax and investment policy reforms that enable governments to promote inclusive and sustainable development, and which benefit (women) small and medium scale producers, their communities and domestic economies.
